Ayssi comensan las paraulas de Albucasim .	Thus begin the words of Albucasis.
O, filhs, pus yeu he a vos complit aquest libre, le qual es le derier de la sciencia de medicina, per le compliment de lu so consequit la fi en lu, e per las exposicios de lu, e per las declaracios de lu, es a mi vist que yeu complesca aquel a vos am aquest tractat, le qual es partida de la operacio am ma, so es cyrurgia.	O, children, since I have completed this book for you, which is the last of the science of medicine, by completing it I have reached its end, and through its expositions and declarations, it seems to me that I have fulfilled it for you with this treatise, which is a part of the surgical operation with my hands.
Quar la operacio am ma es prostrada en nostre regio e en nostre temps de tot privada, entro que fort leu peric la sciencia de lu, e le vistigi de lu es ostat; e no romasero de lu sino alcunas petitas descripcios en les libres dels Antics, les quals mudero las mas e endevenc ad aquels error e heyssitacio entro que son clausas las entencios de lu e es elonguada la forsa de lu e l’art.	Because the surgical operation is widely neglected in our region and our time, the science of it is greatly endangered, and its practice is lost; and there remain only some small descriptions in the books of the Ancients, which have misled many and led to error and hesitation, so that understanding of it is obscured and its strength and art are diminished.
E es vist a mi que yeu vivifique aquela am ordenacio de aquest tractat en aquela segon la via de exposicio e de declaracio e de abreviacio; e per que vengua am las formas dels ferramentz de cautheri e dels autres instrumentz de la obra cum sia per addicio de la declaracio, e per preparacio de lu, la qual causa es necessaria.	And it seems to me that I will revitalize it [the surgical operation] through the organization of this treatise, in accordance with the method of exposition, declaration, and summarization; and so that it will be made clear through the descriptions of cautery instruments and other tools of the craft, both by adding explanations and by preparing them [the tools], which is necessary.
Mays la causa per la qual no es atrobat bo artifex am la sieua ma en aquest nostre temps, es quar la art de medicina es longua, e que cove le sieu actor denant aquo esser excercitat en la sciencia de anotomia la qual recontec Gualia entro que sapia les juvament dels membres e las formas de aquels, e la conjunctio e la separacio de lor; e haia la conoyssensa dels osses, dels nervis e dels lacertz, e·l nombre de aquels, e la egrecio de lor; e de las venas pulsatils e de las quietas, e dels locs del eyssiment de lor.	However, the reason why a skilled artisan with his hands is not easily found in our time is that the art of medicine is extensive, and its practitioner must first be practiced in the science of anatomy, which includes knowledge of the locations and forms of the body's parts, their connections, and separations;  and must have knowledge of the bones, nerves, and tendons, their numbers and courses; and of the pulsating and still veins, and the locations of their exits.
E per aquo ditz Ypocras que am u nom es mot, mays en l’obra petit, e majorment en la art de la ma.	And therefore Hippocrates said that with a name it is much, but in the work little, and especially in the art of the hand.
Mays nos ja avem dit de aquel en l’introit de aquest libre; quar qui no es scient aquo que li avem dit de anotomia, no es evacuat que no caia en error per la qual siran mortz les homes, ayssi cum yeu he vist trops de aquels, quar alscus son formatz en esta sciencia e gettan se de aquela ses sciencia e ses experiment.	But we have already said this in the introduction to this book; for whoever is not knowledgeable about what we have said concerning anatomy, cannot be certain of not falling into an error that will cause people to die, as I have seen many such cases. For some are trained in this science but abandon it without experience or knowledge.
Quar yeu vi un metge folh e enperit aver incidit un apostema escrophilos en le colh de una femna, e incidic alcunas arterias del colh per que fluic gran sanc entro que la femna cazec morta entre las mas de lu.	For I saw a foolish and unskilled surgeon inadvertently open a scrophulous abscess on a woman's neck, and severed some arteries in her neck so that a great deal of blood flowed, causing the woman to die in his hands.
E vi un autre metge que pres que el traguera una peyra d’un home le qual avia procesit en sa etat, e la peyra era gran, e venguet a lu e trayssec aquela peyra am un tros de la vesiqua, per que aquel home al tertz dia es mort.	And I saw another surgeon who claimed to have removed a stone from a man who had suffered from this affliction for a long time, and the stone was large.  He went to the man and removed the stone, taking some of the bladder tissue with it, and the man died on the third day.
E yeu ja apelat fuy a estrayre aquela, e vi que per la grandesa de la peyra e per la disposicio del malaute conogui subre lu que morira.	And I, having already tried to stop it, saw that because of the size of the stone and the patient's condition, I knew beforehand that he would die.
E vi un autre metge le qual prenia stipendic de un duc de nostra terra per cyrurgia, e endeven a un crastrat negre le qual era deves lu fractura en la coyssa de lu; e perparec le metge am la sua ignorancia, estrayssec la fractura, sobre la plagua, am pulvinas e astelas am forta strectura, e no layssec a la plagua espiracio.	And I saw another surgeon who received payment from a duke in our land for surgery, and he went to a blackguard who had a fractured thigh; but because of the surgeon's ignorance, he treated the fracture, placing the wound over pads and splints with excessive tightness, and did not allow the wound to breathe.
E aprop le desliet segons los sieus desiriers, e aprop le relieg, e aprop le leyssec per alcus jorns e comandec que nos deslies le liament; e estec ayssi entro que la coyssa e·l pe foro apostematz, e pervenguet a perdicio.	And he, according to his desires, set it, rejoined it, and left it for a few days, and ordered that the ligament be released.  And it remained like that until the thigh and foot became abscessed and succumbed to ruin.
E yeu fuy apelat a lu, e aparelhegui a desliar le liament, e conseguida es tranquilitat e enayssi amermet de sas dolors.	And I was called to him, and proceeded to release the ligament, and thus tranquility and relief from his pain were achieved.
Mays empero ja corrupcio era confermada en le membre, per que no pogui refrenar aquela, e no cessec perambular la corrupcio en le membre entro que·l malaute peric.	However, the corruption had already taken hold in the limb, so I could not stop it, and the corruption continued in the limb until the patient perished.
E vi un autre metge le qual perforec un apostema cancros, e fo ulcerat aprop alscus dias, entro que foc magnificada la malicia de lu am lo senhor de lu.	And I saw another physician who opened a cancerous abscess, and it ulcerated for several days, until its malice was magnified with the patient's suffering.
La qual causa es quar le cranc caut es pur de humor melencolic, lahoras no cove que pervengua a lu am ferr de tot, sino que sia an membre le qual suffertes que de tot fos hostat.	Since cancer is pure melancholy humor, it should not be treated with a total iron cauterization but rather on a limb where it is sufficient to remove the disease.
E per aquo, filhs, necessari es a vos que la operacio am ma sia devisada en dos devesios: so es en operacio a lu qual es associada salut, e en obra am la qual es perilh en las majors disposicios.	Therefore, children, it is necessary for you that the surgical procedure be divided into two parts: one, the operation that is associated with health, and the other, the work which carries peril in the most important situations.
E yeu ja he exsitat aquo en tot loc de aquest libre en le qual venc opperacio en la qual es error e temor; per que necessari es a vos que guardetz aquo e layssetz aquel, per que les folhs no atrobo via a parlar e a vos desonestar.	And I have already shown this in every part of this book where there is an operation that includes error and fear.  Therefore, it is necessary for you to watch this and leave that behind, so the pages may not find a way to speak and to disgrace you.
E donc prenetz las vostras armas am sollicitut e am proteccio de Dieu , e les vostres malautes am falicitat e am fermetat.	Therefore, take your tools with diligence and with God's protection, and your patients with skill and firmness.
E usatz de la milhor via per la gracia de Dieu perdusent a salut e a lausabla successio, e laysatz las malautias terriblas de difficil sanacio, e ostatz las vostras armas de aquo que vos fa temer, per so que ysitatio en vostra fe e en le vostre nom no vos evasisca: quar mays es remanent a la vostra gloria, e pus aut en le mon e en derier a las vostras sanctitatz.	And use the best path, through God's grace, leading to health and praiseworthy success, and leave behind the terrible illnesses of difficult cure, and remove from your tools that which makes you fear, so that your work in your faith and your name will not be wasted: for more remains for your glory, and higher in the world and behind your sanctity.
Gualia ja diyssec en alcunas sieuas monicios:	Gualia already said in some of his teachings:
“No mediquetz malautia mala, per so que mals metges no siatz nompnatz”.	Do not treat a serious illness, lest you be called bad doctors".
E yeu ja he devesit aquest libre segontz tres capitols.	And I have already divided this book into three chapters.
Comensa la divisio del libre, e primier de la primieyra partida.	Begins the division of the book, and first of the first part.
Le primier capitol ordenat del cap entro·s pes, en las formas dels instrumentz e en les ferrementz dels cauteris, e de aquo que necessari es en la opperacio.	The first chapter, ordered from head to foot, describes the types of instruments and cautery irons, and what is necessary for the operation.
La divisio de la segonda partida.	The division of the second part.
Le segon capitol, de siccio e perforacio, e de ventosas, e de plaguas, e de extractio de sagetas e de semblantz ad aquelas, tot capitolat e ordenat de las formas dels instrumentz.	The second chapter, on cutting and piercing, cupping, poultices, the removal of arrows and similar objects, is entirely about the various types of instruments.
Divisio de la tersa partida.	Division of the third part.
Le tertz capitol, de restauracio e de dislocacio, e de curacio de torcio e de semblantz ad aquels; capitol ordenat del cap entro·s pes, e de las formas dels instrumentz.	The third chapter, on restoring and dislocating, and on treating twists and similar injuries;  ordered from head to foot, and concerning the types of instruments.
De cauteri am foc e am medicina aguda e rememoracio de la opperacio.	Of cauterization with fire and sharp medicine, and a reminder of the procedure.
Am aquel comensa le tractat de tot le libre.	With this begins the treatise of the entire book.
Cove que yeu digua la qualitat dels juvamentz de aquel cauteri e dels noccumentz de lu, e en qual compleccio sia prohibit cauteri.	It is necessary that I describe the benefits and harms of this cauterization, and in which temperament it is forbidden.
Donc dic que·l sermo de la qualitat del juvament de cauteri e del noccument de lu es sermo lonc e prolixs, e subtil per sciensa, e secret amaguat; e ja de lu a parlat gran multitut de savis, e de lu se son desacordatz, et a mi abasta un petit dels sermons de lor, temen perlonguacio.	Therefore, I say that the discussion of the benefits and harms of cauterization is long, detailed, scientifically subtle, and secretly hidden; and many learned individuals have already spoken about it, and disagreed, and it suffices for me to take a little from their discussions, fearing to prolong this.
E donc dic que cauteri comfereys a tota compleccio universalment la qual es am materia o ses materia, exceptat dos compleccios, las quals son compleccios caudas ses materia .	And therefore I say that cauterization is beneficial to all temperaments universally, whether with matter or without matter, except for two temperaments, which are hot temperaments without matter.
En la compleccio cauda e secca am materia se desecordero; quar alcus dyssero que cauteri es juvatiu ad aquela, e les autres dyssero le contrari de aquel, que cauteri no es convenient en malautia la qual es per qualiditat e per siccitat, quar natura del foc es qualiditat e siccitat, e enconvenient es que malautia cauda e secca am aquo que es caut e sec sia sanada.	In the hot and dry temperament with matter, there is disagreement; for some say that cauterization is beneficial to it, and others say the contrary, that cauterization is not suitable for an illness that is due to heat and dryness, since the nature of fire is heat and dryness, and it is inappropriate for a hot and dry illness to be treated with something that is also hot and dry.
E diysec aquel que ditz le contrari de aquel, que per cauteri es fayt juvament en tota malautia cauda e secca que ve en les cors dels homes, quar quan tu comparas le cors de home e las humiditatz de lu a la compleccio del foc, atrobas le cors de home freg.	And those who say the opposite argue that cauterization is beneficial in all hot and dry illnesses that affect the body, because when you compare the body's moisture to the nature of fire, you find the body to be cold.
E yeu dic per le sermo de aquel, que esperiment aquo ja a mi alscunas vetz a descubert.	And I say, based on this argument, that experience has revealed this to me several times.
Mays empero no cove que vengua sobre aquo aquel que ja es exproat e excersitat en le capitol de cauteri per derier exercici, e a conogut la diversitat de la compleccio dels homes e la disposicio de las malautias en lor meteyssas, e las causas de aquelas, e·ls accidentz de lor, e l’espasi del temps de aquelas.	However, this should not be taken up by one who is not experienced and practiced in the chapter on cauterization through prior exercises, and who has not known the diversity of human temperaments and the nature of illnesses themselves, their causes, their symptoms, and the time-frame of these illnesses.
Mays en las autras compleccios, no es sobre vos temor, e majorment en las malautias fregas e humidas, quar ja totz les metges se son acordatz sobre aquels, e no so desecordatz en le juvament am cauteri en aquelas.	But in other temperaments, you have no fear, and especially in cold and moist illnesses, for all physicians have agreed upon these, and are not divided on the use of cauterization in them.
E sapiatz, filhs, que del secret de curacio per cauteri am foc e de la bontat de lu, so sobre cauteri am medicina comburent, es quar le foc es simple, la accio del qual no perven sino al membre le qual es cauterizat e no notz al autre membre am lu ajustat sino am petit nocument.	And know, children, that the secret of healing through cauterization with fire, and its effectiveness,  is in contrast to cauterization with medicinal burning agents, because fire is simple, its action only affecting the member being cauterized and not harming the adjacent member, except perhaps with little harm.
Mays la accio de medicina comburent perven ad aquel en les membres le qual de lu alunhat, e fort leu fa venir en le membre malautia de dificil sanacio e fort leu ausit.	But the action of medicinal burning agents reaches the members further away, and easily brings illness of difficult healing to the afflicted member and easily causes pain.
Mays le foc, per la sua sublimitat e de la sua substancia bontat, no fa aquo sino que superfluisca E ja es a nos conogut per experiment e per longitut de servitut de studi am l’art sobre le veritat de las causas; e per aquo yeu so excusat de la longitut del sermo E si no fos que no es legut al mieu libre en aquest pausero a vos secret amaguat am le foc, e la qualitat de la operacio de lu en les cors e de la sieua expulcio per la qual expellis las malautias, am sermo philosophic demostratiu, le qual siria acuit en las vostras pessas.	But fire, because of its superior nature and beneficial substance, does not do this, but rather it simply burns. And this is known to us through experience and a long study of the art, concerning the truth of the causes; therefore, I am excused from the length of this speech.  And if it were not that this is not found in my book on this subject, concerning the hidden secrets of fire, and the nature of its operation on the body and its expulsion of illness, with a philosophical demonstration, which would be beneficial to your understanding.
E sapiatz, filhs, que els se desacordan del temps en le qual es convenient far cauteri e pausan le milhor temps de primaveyra.	And know, children, that they disagree on the time when it is best to perform cauterization, and they consider spring the best time.
E yeu dic que cauteri es convenient en tot temps, per so que le nocument per le temps accident es submergit en le juvament de aquo que am le cauteri es atirat, e majorment si le cauteri es per dolors o de dolors necessaries, fortz e fistinas, las quals no suffertan tarditat per so que es temut de aquelas que vengua malicia, que es major que petit nocument entrant per lo temps.	And I say that cauterization is appropriate at all times, because the harm caused by the passing of time is overshadowed by the benefit derived from the cauterization, and especially if the cauterization is for severe, sudden pains or necessary ones, which cannot tolerate delay because the feared harm may be greater than the minor harm caused by time passing.
E aysso no catz en vostras pessas, o, filhs, aquo no estiman sino le poble vulguar e les fols metges, so es que ad aquela malautia que es sanada per cauteri no es redicio tot temps, e pausan aquel consequen.	And this is not considered by you, children, or by foolish doctors, because it is understood that the illness cured by cauterization does not have a fixed time for treatment, and they disregard that consequence.
E la causa no es ges ayssi quo els cuydan per aquo, quar cauteri no es sino en loc de medicina la qual altera la compleccio e esicca las humiditatz las quals son causa per que veno las dolors.	And the cause is not at all as they imagine, for cauterization is not simply a place for medicine, but rather an alteration of the constitution, drying out the moisture which is the cause of the pain.
Mays empero cauteri superflueys sobre la medicina per volicitat de la sua valitut e vertut de la sua operacio e grandesa del sieu senhor.	However, cauterization is superior to other medicine because of its power, efficacy, and the greatness of its effect.
E es possible que la sua malautia retorne en alcuna hora del temps, segon la compleccio del malaute e la locacio de la sua malautia, e la vertut de lu, e aquo que es preparat en le cors de lu de la agreguacio de las superfluitatz en lu, e aquo que es pervengut a lu en la sua acquisicio en viandas e semblantz de aquelas causas; sino que la malautia en la qual sia aministrat cauteri sia malautia subtil en membre de paucas superfluitatz e humiditatz, ayssi cum cauteri de dent per dolor e semblantz ad aquel, possible es que en lu no retorne aquela dolor, mays aquo se fa en petitz.	And it is possible that their illness may return at some time, according to the patient's constitution, the location of their illness, the body's disposition, and the accumulation of superfluities within them, as well as what they have ingested in food and similar matters. However, if the illness for which cauterization is administered is a minor one, affecting only a small area with little superfluity and moisture, like a toothache or similar situations, then it's possible the pain will not return, but this happens in small cases.
E mays sermo vulgar es que cauteri es le derier remezi de medicina, e es sermo dreyturier, no ad aquo que els entendo en lu, quar els crezo que no es curacio que aprofieyta am medicina ni am autra causa aprop cauteri.	And the common saying is that cauterization is the final remedy in medicine, and that is a true statement, not as they understand it, for they believe there is no cure that is as effective as cauterization, or with any other means.
E la causa es en contrari de aquo; e la entencio que cauteri es le derier remezi de medicina no es sino quan administram las manieyras de curacio en alcunas malautias, e aquelas medicinas no conferieysso, e aprop en la fi de la causa aministra hom cauteri, e aprofieyta ad aquela.	And the truth is the opposite; the idea that cauterization is the last resort in medicine is only true when administering treatments for certain illnesses, and those treatments aren't effective.  It is only at the end, as a final measure, that cauterization is applied, and then it can be effective.
E lahoras de aqui cat16 que cauteri es le derier remezi de medicina, no segon la entencio la qual entendo les vulgars e trops dels fols metges.	Therefore, the statement that cauterization is the last resort in medicine, is not true according to the understanding of the common people and many foolish doctors.
E diyssero les antics que cauteri am aur es milhor que cauteri am ferr, e no diyssero aquo sino per la equalitat del aur e sublimitat de la sua sustancia.	And the ancients said that cauterization with gold is better than cauterization with iron, and they said this only because of the purity and superior substance of gold.
E diyssero que le loc de cauteri no fa brac, cum aquo no sia absolutament vertat, quar yeu ja he aquo proat e he atrobat que aquel no fa aquo sino en alcus cors ses les autres, e cauteri am aquel es bo e milhor que am ferr ayssi quo els diyssero; mays empero quan tu fas cauteri am foc am de aur, no es a tu declarat, quar es egnit segon la quantitat que tu vols per la rugor de l’aur, e quar prepara a recebre freg; e si ajustas sobre lu ignicio se fon l’aur per le foc, e caso en le foc alcunas laminas per que le artifex catz per la occupacio de aquel.	And they said that the location of the cauterization doesn't matter, but that's not entirely true, for I have proven it and found that this is only true in some bodies and not others, and cauterization with gold is better than with iron as they say; however, when you cauterize with gold, it's not entirely clear to you, because it melts according to the amount you want, due to the gold's hardness, and because it prepares to receive cold; and if you add heat to it, the gold melts, and the craftsman loses some shavings in the process.
E per aquo es fayt cauteri am ferr deves nos pus leugerament e pus propdanament a rectitut de operacio.	Therefore, cauterization with iron is done more easily and more directly to achieve the desired result.
E yeu ja he ordenat aquest capitol en le cauteri segon capitols, et he ordenat aquels del cap entro les pes, per so que aleugo le demandant aquo que vol de lu.	And I have organized this chapter on cauterization into sections, and I have ordered them from head to foot, so that the seeker can find what they want.
De cauteri de dolor de cap per frigiditat e humiditat.	Of cauterization for headaches caused by cold and dampness.
Le capitol primier.	The first chapter.
Aquesta cauterizacio confereys a la humiditat e frigiditat sobre le servel accident de la qual so doas causas, so es causa de soda e multitut de flux raumatic, apelat corissa, del cap a las partidas dels huelhs e de las aurelhas fluent, e multitut de dormir, e de dolor de dentz e del guolayro, e universalment de tota malautia que ve per fregiditat, ayssi cum paraliticament, sodo e apoplexio, e semblantz en aquelas malautias.	This cauterization addresses dampness and coldness affecting the brain, which has two causes:  a copious and numerous rheumatic flux, called catarrh, flowing from the head to the eye and ear regions, excessive sleep, toothache, and throat problems, and generally all ailments stemming from coldness, such as paralysis, stroke, and similar illnesses.
La forma de aquesta cauterizacio es aquesta, que primieyrament comandes al malaute que sia evacuat am medicina lacsativa le cap mondificant, per tres o per quatre nueytz, segon que exhigeys la vertut del malaute e la edat de lu e la sua costuma.	The method of this cauterization is as follows:  first, order the patient to be purged with laxative medicine for three or four nights, according to the patient's strength, age, and usual response.
E aprop comanda li que raza le sieu cap am razor, e aprop fay aquel sezer entre las tuas mas sobre una banca cayrada e que pause las suas mas sobre le pietz sieu.	Then command him to shave his head, and afterward, place him seated between your hands on a smooth bench and have him place his hands on his feet.
E aprop pausa la razit de la tua palma aprop le pous sobre la razit del nas entre les huels sieus.	And then, place the blade of your palm near the bridge of his nose, between his eyes.
Mays empero, cum le tieu dit del mieg loc es pervengut, signa aquel loc am tenta, e aprop igneys le cauteri olivar del qual aquesta es la forma:	However, when your middle finger has reached that spot, mark that spot with a tent, and then apply the olive cautery, whose form is:
E aprop pausa aquel sobre le loc senhat am tenta, a manieyra que descent, am la qual la tieua ma sia constrengida petit a petit, e tu revolveys aquel.	And then place that [cautery] over the spot marked with the tent, in a downward-pressing manner, so that your hand is gradually compressed, and you rotate it.
E aprop leva la tua ma leugerament e reguarda le loc, e si veses ja del os esser descubert alcuna quantitat del cap, ayssi cum la quantitat de gra de errs, lahoras eleva la tua ma, e si no torno la tua ma am aquel ferr, am autre de aquel, si es enfrigidat, entro que sia vist del os aquo que yeu he dit a tu.	And then gently lift your hand and observe the spot. If you see any significant amount of bone exposed, about the size of a grain of millet, then lift your hand; and if not, return your hand with that iron, with another of them, if it has cooled, until the bone is visible as I have told you.
E aprop pren un petit de sal e disolveys aquel sobre le loc e leyssa aquel per tres jorns.	And then take a little salt and dissolve it on the spot, and leave it for three days.
E aprop pausa sobre lu coto enbegut en boder e leyssa aquel sobre lu entro que sia destrusida la scara del foc.	Then place a cloth soaked in broth over it and leave it there until the burn scar from the fire is destroyed.
E aprop cura le loc am anguent tetrafarmacon entro que sia sanat.	And then treat the area with four-drug ointment until it is healed.
E ja diyssero que quant la plagua roman uberta, tant mielhs geta le brac, per que es milhor e mays juvatiu.	And if they say that when the wound remains open, it is better to leave the arm hanging down, because that is better and more helpful.
E diyssero alcus de lor que sia cauterizada la codena entro al os, e sia tengut le cauteri entro que sia adhurida alcuna partida de la specitut del os.	And some of them say that the bone should be cauterized down to the bone, and the cautery should be held until some part of the bone's substance is burned.
E aprop sia ras aquo que es adhust del os, e aprop sia curat.	And then remove what has adhered to the bone, and then treat it.
E diyssero autres que am lo cauteri pervengua al derier, entro que enprema en le os forta enprecio entro que le os caga, e aquesta es la forma de alphecati petit:	And others say that with the cautery, you should go deep, until it firmly penetrates the bone until the bone breaks, and this is the method of small cautery.
E estiman de aquel loc expiran la vapors del cap.	And they believe that from that location the vapors of the head escape.
E sia tenguda la plagua uberta per lonc temps, e aprop sia curada entro que sia consolidada.	And the wound should be kept open for a long time, and then treated until it is healed.
Mays a mi no so vistas aquestas doas specias de cauteri de tot, sino en alcus homes segon via de temor; e layssa aquel, deves mi, milhor es am salut, quan es; quar le cap es develitat per solucio de continuitat de lu ayssi cum havem testificat en les autres membres, e majorment quan le cap del malaute es de freul natura.	However, I have not seen these two types of cautery in all cases, but in some individuals according to the method of fear; and, in my opinion, it is better to be safe than sorry.  For the head is weakened by a disruption of its continuity, just as we have observed in other parts of the body, and especially when the patient's head is of a fragile nature.
E la specia de cauteri primieyra es mays salva e milhor deves mi; e de aquela husi e am aquela obra am salut.	And the first type of cautery is safer and better in my opinion; and with that usage and method, there is safety.
Capitol segon.	Second Chapter.
Del cauteri del cap.	Of the cautery of the head.
Quan en tot le cap accideys dolor cronica e longua e aquo es en le malaute prolonguat, e usa de gerras e de cochias e de capipurges e de emplaustres e de guatz e de cadels e de gualinas e de semblantz, e majorment si ja es cauterizat am un cautere le qual recontam e no aprofieyta a lu deguna de aquelas causas, lahoras considera quar si le cap del malaute es de fort creacio en la sua natura; e no es freul et atroba mot gran freg, lahoras aquel cauterisa am autra cauteri dejos aquel un pauc.	When chronic and prolonged pain affects the entire head of a prolonged illness, and remedies such as leeches, cupping, purging, plasters, poultices, and similar applications have been used, and especially if the head has already been cauterized with a cautery that has not benefited the patient, then consider this: if the patient's head is strong in its nature and not fragile, and it suffers from significant cold, then cauterize with another cautery slightly below the previous one.
E aprop cauterisa aquel sobre le corn del sieu cap am cauteri entro que la codena es partida.	And then cauterize that area above the patient's head with the cautery until the inflammation is broken up.
Incisa la codena e sia descuberta del os la quantitat la qual havem recontat e cauteriza aquel am un cauteri en la partida deriera del cap en le loc le qual es apelat vas, — e es aquel loc en le qual es pausada ventosa.	Cut into the inflammation and expose the bone to the extent we have described, and cauterize that with a cautery on the back part of the head, in the area called the *vas* (vein) — which is the area where a cupping glass is placed.
Et alleuja la tua ma en aysso, e no descobras le os, quar le malaute per aquo atroba mot gran dolor diversa de la dolor de totz les autres cauteris del cap.	And ease your hand in this, and do not expose the bone, for the patient will suffer much greater pain from this than from all other head cauteries.
E yeu diyre aquest cauteri en son loc, quar cove que·l cauteri am le qual so cauterisatz les corns del cap e le occiput es pus subtil cauteri que aquel am le qual es cauterisat le mieg loc del cap; e aquesta es la forma de lu.	And I will say this about the cautery in its place, for the cautery with which the horns of the head and the occiput are cauterized must be a more delicate cautery than the one used on the middle part of the head; and this is the method for it.
Capitol ters.	Third Chapter.
De cauterisacio de emigranea no-antiqua.	Concerning the cauterization of chronic migraines.
Quan endeve en la partida del cap dolor sodo, o es stenduda dolor entro al uelh, sia evacuat am medicinas le cap mondificantz, e sia aministrada l’autra curacio, la qual yeu he dita en las devesios de las malautias; e tot no aprofieyta, lahoras cauterisacio en lu es en dos manieyras: o cauterisacio am medicina acuta comburent, o am ferr.	When there is constant pain in the head, or pain spreading to the eye, the head should be cleansed with remedies, and the other treatment I have mentioned in the discussions of diseases should be administered. If all else fails, cauterization in that area is done in two ways: either with a sharp, burning medicine, or with iron.
Mays cauteri am medicina comburent es que tu prenguas una dolsa de alh, e escorgas aquela e abcindas las extremitatz de lu de amdos les caps.	However, cauterization with a burning medicine is when you take a clove of garlic, peel it, and excise the ends of both its heads.
E aprop incideys le loc de la dolor en la templa am una lanceta lada entro que sia en lu feyt loc dejos la codena, entro que sia occultada.	And then, with a thin lancet, cut into the painful area on the temple until a small area is created underneath the skin, so that it is hidden.
E aprop strenh sobre lu am stopada per descent constreccio, e layssa aquel per le spazi de tres horas; e aprop deslia le e tratz le alh, e laysa la plagua per dos o per tres jorn, e aprop pausa sobre lu coto submergit en boder entro que le loc fassa brac.	Then press upon it with a compress for a slow constriction, and leave it for three hours; then remove it and take away the garlic, and allow the wound to heal for two or three days, and then place a cloth soaked in wine or something similar on the area until it forms a scab.
E aprop cura aquel am enguent entro que sia sanat.	And then treat it with ointment until it is healed.
E si tu voys, fe aquo am alcunas medicinas comburentz las quals yeu he scriutas en le douse tractat de medicinas comburentz.	And if you wish, do this with some burning medicines which I have written about in the second treatise on burning medicines.
Mays la cauterisacio am ferr segon aquesta manieyra: igneys per cauteri del qual aquesta es la forma:	But the cauterization with iron, according to this method: apply fire with a cautery, the procedure for which is as follows:
e es apelat claus clavilhs, quar le cap de lu es ayssi cum forma de clavel en le qual es alcuna curvitat, e·n le mieg loc de lu es eminensia petita.	and it is called a 'claus clavilhs', because the head of it is shaped like a nail, with a slight curvature, and in the middle is a small projection.
E aprop pausa sobre loc de la dolor, e rete la tua ma — per que no sia adhurida la arceria la qual es dejos — e revol le ferr petit a petit am velocitat.	And then place it over the painful area, and hold your hand — so that the tissue underneath isn't burned — and slowly rotate the small iron with speed.
E si la quantitat de lu que es adhurida per la specitut de la codena ayssi quo la maytat de lu, e elava la tua ma per so que la arteria no sia adhurida la qual es dejos, per so que no vengua flux de sanc.	And if the amount burned by the application of the cautery is as much as half of it, lift your hand so that the artery underneath isn't burned, so that blood flow doesn't occur.
E aprop enbibeys coto en aygua de sal e pausa aquel sobre le loc, e layssa aquel per tres dias; e aprop pausa coto mulhat am boder, e aprop cura am enguent entro que sia sanat.	And then soak cotton in salt water and place it on the area, and leave it for three days; then place cotton soaked in wine, and then treat with ointment until healed.
E si voys, cauterisa am la extremitat del cutellari segon cauteri, e guarda te de incisio de arteria en aquesta emigranea propriament no-antiqua.	And if you wish, cauterize with the blade of a scalpel, according to the cautery method, and be careful not to cut an artery in this specific, not-ancient, procedure.
Capitol quart.	Fourth Chapter.
De cauterizacio d’emigranea antiqua.	Of the cauterization of old migraines.
Quan tu curas emigranea am aquo que havem dit de la curacio precedent, e aquo que havem dit en las divisios de las malautias, e no aprofieyta la curacio, e vezes per la malautia que no abasta a lu aquo que havem dit del primier cauteri am medicina o del cauteri am foc, lahoras cove que tu igniscas le cauteri cutellar entro que sia albificat, pus que significas sobre le loc de la dolor am linha de longuesa de la qual sia la maytat del dit, o quays aquel; e depausa la tua ma per una veguada e strenh aquela entro incidiscas la arceria e pervengua entro al os.	When you treat a migraine using the methods described in the previous treatment, and in the divisions of diseases, and the treatment is ineffective, and sometimes because the illness prevents you from using the previous cauterization methods with medicine or with fire, then you should heat the surgical knife until it is white-hot, and then apply it to the area of pain in a line that is half the length of your finger, or less; and hold your hand in place once and press firmly until you cut the artery and penetrate to the bone.
Empero necessari es a tu que guardes de la continuacio de la mandibula, la qual es mauguda deves la masticacio, e que le lacert no sia adhurit e le nervi le qual mau aquela, e que no s’endevengua espasme.	However, it is necessary for you to be careful about the continuation of the jaw, which is strained by chewing, and that the ligament and the nerve that move it are not injured, and that a spasm does not ensue.
E si es sobre la custodia e cautela de flux de sanc de l’arteria que es abciza, quar en la abcizio de lu es temor, e majorment ad aquel le qual ignora aquo que fa e no es studios e esproat; e layssa la operacio en lu al comensament.	And if it concerns the guarding and caution against the flow of blood from the cut artery, for there is a fear in cutting it, and especially for the one who does not know what they are doing and is not skilled and experienced; and abandons the procedure prematurely.
E yeu vindre am rememoracio del regiment de flux de sanc accident de la arceria segon la sieua manieyra, en le sieu loc de aquest libre.	And I will come back to the treatment of accidental blood flow from an artery according to its specific method, in its place in this book.
E si veses de aquesta malautia que no abaste aquest cauteri e veses le cors del malaute tollerable, cauteriza aquel en le mieg loc del cap ayssi cum havem recontat, e cura la plagua entro que sia sanada.	And if you see that this ailment is not cured by this cauterization, and you see that the patient's condition is tolerable, cauterize the middle of the head as previously described, and treat the wound until it heals.
E si voys, aministra le cauteri le qual havem dit en le capitol de streccio de arceria am cauteri havent dos cotels, e es milhor cauterizacio aquesta e mays conferent.	And if you wish, administer the cautery which we described in the chapter on the constriction of an artery with a cautery having two blades; this is a better and more effective cauterization.
Capitol .v.	Chapter 5.
De cauterisacio de las dolors de aurelhas.	Of cauterization for ear pain.
Quan en la aurelha ve dolor per freg e es curat am causas lacsativas e am l’autra curacio la qual he dita en la divisio, e no es remauguda la dolor, lahoras igneys le cauteri, e es aquest le qual ha nom puncta, del qual aquesta es la forma:	When pain in the ear comes from cold and is treated with laxatives and the other remedies mentioned in the division, and the pain is not relieved, then apply the cautery, and this is the one called the 'puncta' cautery, which has this form:
E aprop puncta aprop la ignicio, e sia menat al enviro de tota la aurelha ayssi cum roda es revolguda, o en le circuit de quascuna essemps si la dolor es en quascuna.	And then apply the cautery, close to the ignition point, and move it around the entire ear in a circular motion, or on the spot where the pain is localized if the pain is in a particular area.
Alonga te am le cauteri de la razit de la aurelha pauc a pauc pus que aias senhat le loc am tenta.	Move the cautery along the ear's base slowly, after marking the location with a probe.
E si le cauteri de detz puntz en tota aurelha, e quays aquela, e aprop cura les locz entro que sian sanatz.	And if the cautery has made ten punctures in the ear, and cauterizes those, and then treat the areas until they are healed.
Capitol .vi.	Chapter 6.
De cauterizacio de turtura.	Of cauterization for torture.
Turtura la qual es curada e am cauterizacio no es sino de las specias las quals veno per flecma, segon que havem dit en las divisios de las malautias.	Torture which is cured with cauterization is only of the types that arise from phlegm, as we have said in the divisions of diseases.
Esquiva cauterizacio de la specia que endeve per siccacio o per spasme del nervi.	Avoid cauterization of the type that arises from dryness or spasm of the nerve.
Quan tu curas aquela specia de turtura am jerras e capipurgi e guarguarismes, e no comfereys la tua curacio, lahoras cove que tu cauterizas le malaute am tres cauteris: la i deves la razit de la aurelha, e·l segon un petit dejos le sieu templar, e le ters deves la conjunccio de doas labias.	When you treat that type of torture with poultices, purges, and remedies, and your treatment doesn't work, then you should cauterize the patient with three cauteries: the first at the base of the ear, the second a little below their temple, and the third at the junction of the two lips.
E pausa lo tieu cauteri per le contrari de la partida malauta, quar mollificacio no ve sino en la partida que apar sana.	And place your cautery on the opposite side of the diseased part, for softening only occurs in the apparently healthy part.
E la forma de cauterisacio es que cauterizas aquel am le cauteri en le dreyt de la extremitat de la aurelha pus sobirana un petit sobre le corn del cap, e en le templar autre, la longuesa del qual sia segon la longitut del dit pous, e depausa la tua ma am cauteri entro que sia comburida la quantitat de la maytat de la specitut de la codena.	And the method of cauterization is to cauterize with the cautery at the right point of the ear's extremity, a little above the corner of the head, and another on the temple, its length being equal to the length of the thumb.  You should press your cautery until the amount of the diseased area's thickness is half burned.
E aquesta es la forma del cauteri, e es specia del cutellari, la forma del qual es denant mesa.	And this is the method of cauterization, and it is a type of surgery, the method of which is described below.
Mays empero pus subtil es que aquel un pauc ayssi co vesas; e cove que cotel en lu de superflua groceza un pauc.	However, it is more subtle than what you see; and the knife should remove a little bit of superfluous flesh.
E aprop cura le loc am aquo que es denant procezit entro que sia sanat.	And then treat the area with what has been previously prescribed until it is healed.
Capitol .vii.	Chapter 7.
De cauterizacio de apoplextia antiqua.	Concerning cauterization of old apoplexy.
Quan apoplextia es antiquada e curas aquela am aquo que havem dit e no confereys la tua medicacio e le malaute no ha febre, lahoras cauteriza aquel am quatre cauteris: sobre totz les corn del sieu cap; e am cauteri e le mieg loc del cap, ayssi cum havem dit; e am cauteri en le coguot.	When apoplexy is longstanding and you have treated it with what we have mentioned, and your treatment is not succeeding, and the patient has no fever, then cauterize in four places: above all the corners of their head; and with a cautery in the middle of the head, as we have said; and with a cautery in the groin.
E la manieyra del cauteri es fayta segon que es desus dit.	And the method of cauterization is done according to what has been previously stated.
E ja es cauterizat sobre la boca del estomac; e es mays derier; e aprop sia curat am aquo que procezeys.	And it has already been cauterized on the mouth of the stomach; and it is further back; and subsequently it should be treated with what you are continuing to do.
Capitol .viii.	Chapter 8.
De cauterizacio de obblivio fayta per flacma.	Of cauterization of forgetfulness caused by flame.
Cove que sian donatz al malaute en le comensament jerras grans e pilulas le servel mondificantz.	There should be given to the patient at the beginning large jars and pills that purify the brain.
E aprop ras le cap tot del malaute e pausa sus le coguot de lu emplaustre de cetre descrit en le tractat dels emplastres.	And then shave the patient's entire head and apply a plaster of centaury described in the treatise on plasters to their forehead.
E pausa aquel alcunas veguadas, quar aquel es manieyra de cauteri.	And apply that several times, for that is a method of cauterization.
E fay aquo segon aquel meteys orde le qual ja he dit.	And do this according to the same order which I have already said.
E donc si per aqueles sanat bo es; e sino, lahoras fay a lu tres cauteris en la deriera partida de sieu cap, les quals sian deysendentz de la partida pus sobirana del cap entro a la partida pus dejos del col.	And thus, if that heals him well, then do three cauteries on the back part of his head, which descend from the highest part of the head down to the lowest part of the neck.
E pausa entre quascun cauteri la grossetut del dit, e aprop cura lo cauteri am aquo que es procedit.	And place the width of a finger between each cautery, and then treat the cautery with what has been previously described.
Mays si tu vos addicio e le malaute es aquo tollerant, lahoras fay a lu cauteri en le mieg loc; e si voys major addicio, lahora cauteriza aquel sobre les dos corns.	But if the application [of cauterization] is gentle and the patient tolerates it, then apply the cautery to the middle part; and if the application is more intense, then cauterize it at the two points/horns.
Aprop cura aquel entro que sia sanat; e sia le cauteri olivar segon la forma denant donat.	Then treat it until it is healed; and let the cautery be oiled according to the form given before.
Capitol .ix.	Chapter 9.
De cauterisacio de parazili e de mollificacio de tot le cors.	Of cauterization for paralysis and softening of the entire body.
Cove que tu procesiscas en mondificacio del cap am jerras e am aquo que havem dit; e aprop ras le cap del malaute, e aprop cauteriza aquel am cauteri en le mieg loc del cap, e am cauteri sobre totz les corns del cap, e am cauteri sobre la deriera partida de lu, e am tres cauteris sobre les spondils del col.	You must proceed with cleansing the head with herbs and as we have said; then shave the patient's head, and then cauterize it with a cautery in the middle of the head, and with cauteries on all the points/horns of the head, and with a cautery on the back part of it, and with three cauteries on the vertebrae of the neck.
E si es necessari en la malautia de mollificacio del cors de trops aquel e les malautes tollerantz e la malautia es fort, lahoras cauteriza aquel am quatre cauteris sobre les spondils del dos, e dererament am cauteri entro que sia comborit de la codena mot de lu, e aleva la tieua ma.	And if, in the illness of softening of the body, the patient is weak and the illness is severe, then cauterize them with four cauteries on the vertebrae of the back, and indeed with a cautery until it is quite softened and the skin is significantly loosened, and then lift your hand.
E aprop cura aquel entro que sia sanat, e aquest sia cauteri olivar.	And then treat it until it is healed, and this should be an olive oil cautery.
Capitol .x.	Chapter 10.
De cauterisacio de epilemcia.	Concerning the cauterization of epilepsy.
No es cauterizat le epilemtic sino aquella epilemcia es per flecma.	The epileptic is not cauterized unless the epilepsy is caused by phlegm.
E donc cove que mondifiques le cervel de lu al comensament de lu am yeras e am l’autra curacio la qual havem dicta en la divisio quan le malaute es gran e es tollerant la exceperacio de las medicinas.	Therefore, it is necessary to treat the brain of the person at the outset with herbs and the other treatment we have discussed in the division when the illness is severe and tolerates the removal of medicines.
E si es enfant le qual no sufferte las medicinas, lahoras aministra guarguarissmes e mastiguatoris le servel mondifican, denant aquo per motz dias, am bonifficacio de las viandas.	And if it is a child who cannot tolerate the medicines, then administer soothing remedies and masticatories that treat the brain, for several days beforehand, along with improving the diet.
E aprop ras le cap del malaute, e aprop cauteriza aquel am un cauteri en le mieg loc del cap segon la manieyra precedent, e am autre cauteri en le occiput de lu, e sobre quascun corn del cap sieu cauterisa.	And then shave the patient's head, and then cauterize the middle of the head with a cautery according to the previous method, and with another cautery on the back of the head, and cauterize on each temple.
E si le malaute es fort e es tollerant, lahoras cauteriza aquel am cauteris les quals he ditz, en havent paraliticament e mollificacio del cors sobre les spondils del col e les spondils del dos.	And if the illness is severe and tolerates it, then cauterize the affected area with the cauteries mentioned, having previously achieved paralysis and softening of the body on the vertebrae of the neck and the vertebrae of the back.
E sia cauteri olivar segon qu’es precedit.	Let the cautery be olive-shaped, as previously described.
Mays si le malaute es enfant, lahoras pausa cauteri subtil segon aquesta manieyra.	But if the patient is a child, then use a delicate cautery according to this method.
Capitol .xi.	Chapter 11.
De cauterizacio de melencolia.	On the cauterization of melancholy.
Quan las causas de melencolia so humiditatz corrompudas e flacma gros, lahoras cauteriza aquel am les cauteris les quals havem ditz en le havent paralisi.	When the causes of melancholy are corrupt humours and a thick phlegm, then cauterize that with the cauteries we have described in the case of paralysis.
E si la causa de melencolia es superfluitat declinant a melencolia, e le cors del malaute es humit, lahoras da ha beure aquo que mundifica le cervel de lu segon aquo que ha precedut en la divisio.	And if the cause of melancholy is a superfluity tending towards melancholy, and the patient's body is humid, then give him to drink what purifies his brain, according to what has been stated in the division [preceding sections].
E aprop ras le cap del malaute, e aprop fay tortora decentment fayta de li sobre le cercle, e aprop depausa aquela en le mieg loc del cap.	Then shave the patient's head, and then apply a properly made trepanation to the skull, and then place it in the middle of the head.
E le malaute sia sesent cayrat, e sia tengut de tota partida.	And the patient should be seated upright, and held steady on all sides.
E aprop pausa liniment; et es pus digne de boder antic de ovelhas.	Then apply a liniment; and an old sheep's fleece is most suitable.
E escalfa aquel sobre le foc per calefaccio temprada per mesura, le qual le dit sufferta quan es mes en lu.	And heat that over a fire with a moderate, measured heat, which the said patient can tolerate when it is applied to him.
E aprop vuo’ aquel en le mieg loc del cap de lu en le cercle, e leysa lu entro que sia enfregidat.	And then place that in the middle of the patient's head, within the cranium, and leave it until it has cooled.
E fay aquo am le malaute en tota semmana una veguada, am le autre regiment de lu bo entro que sia sanat; o si vols, cauteriza aquel fazen petitz puntz segon lo mays de lu, sino que tenguas la ma am un cauteri ayssi ordenat: aquesta es specia de cauteri la qual humecta le cervel am equalitat.	And do this to the patient once a week, along with the other treatments prescribed for him, until he is healed; or if you wish, cauterize that area making small punctures according to the patient's tolerance, but keep your hand with a cautery that is suitably adjusted: this is a type of cautery that moistens the brain evenly.
E aprop pausa aquel coto enbegut en boder o en grays de gualina.	And then apply that cloth soaked in wool or flaxseed poultice.
Capitol .xii.	Chapter 12.
De cauterisacio de aygua descendent en le huel.	Concerning the cauterization of descending water in the ear.
Quan a tu es declarat le comensament de aygua en le huel per les senhals les quals yeu he ditz en la divisio, lahoras comensa e dona en beure al malaute aquo que mondifique le cap de lu, e guarda aquel de totas humiditatz.	When you have identified the onset of water in the ear, using the signs I described in the previous section, then begin giving the patient drinks that will regulate their head and keep it free from moisture.
E fay aquel suzar en banh en degu per alcus jorns.	And have them sweat in a bath for several days.
E aprop comanda a lu que raza le sieu cap, e cauteriza aquel am cauteri en le mieg loc del cap; e aprop cauteriza aquel am dos cauteris sobre dos templas si es le comensament de ysement de aygua en dos huels, o de la un latz si es comensamen de l’aygua en un huel.	Then order the patient to shave their head, and cauterize it with a cautery in the middle of the head; and then cauterize with two cauteries above the two temples if the beginning of the water in both ears is the issue, or on one side if it's just one ear.
Incideys am cauteri totas las venas e arcerias las quals so dejos la codena; e sian les cauteris en aquela lonh en la latitut de las templas.	Cut with a cautery all the veins and arteries that are below the scalp; and let the cauteries be of such a length as the width of the temples.
E guarda te de fluxs de sanc quan es cauterizat; e si veses de lu fluxs de sanc, osta le am alcuna medicina, la qual es a tu possible.	And be careful of blood flow when cauterizing; and if you see blood flow from it, stop it with any medicine possible.
E yeu vindre am savieza la qual es en extraccio de arcerias e am abscizio de aquelas e cautela de fluxs de sanc.	And I will come with skill in the extraction of arteries and with the excision of them and the caution against blood flow.
E alcunas vetz es cauterizat en le cervitz dejos dos osses am dos cauteris dererament produzitz.	And sometimes it is cauterized on the neck between the two bones with two cauteries properly positioned.
Capitol .xiii.	Chapter 13.
De cauterizacio de lacrimas antiquas.	Of cauterization of old sores.
Quan lacrimas dels huels so antiquas assuduament e per las venas e arterias las quals so en le loc manifest del cap defora e es verificat que aquo es superfluitatz frejas flecmatiquas, lahoras cauteriza aquel am cauteri le qual havem recontat en le capitol de comensament de aygua cazent en les huels, e am cauteri en le mieg loc del cap e am dos cauteris en la cervitz dejos dos templas, e am dos cauteris en la cervitz dejos dos osses.	When sores on the eyes are old and persistent, and through the veins and arteries in the visible part of the head's exterior, and it is verified that this is a superfluity of cold phlegm, then cauterize it with the cautery we described in the chapter on hot water applications to the eyes, and with a cautery in the middle of the head and with two cauteries on the neck below the two temples, and with two cauteries on the neck below the two bones (skull).
E si indigeyses de addicio, lahoras cauteriza aquel en tot latz de la coa del huel sobre la extremitat del sobrecilh am petit cauteri.	And if further application is needed, then cauterize it along the entire length of the eye socket, on the brow ridge, with a small cautery.
Capitol .xiiii.	Chapter 14.
De cauterizacio de fetor de nas.	Of cauterization of a foul odor from the nose.
Quan tu medicas aquel am aquo que havem dit en la divisio e no aprofieyta la tua medicacio, lahoras tu aparelha e dona en beure al malaute las cochias per tres noytz; e aprop ras le cap de lu, e cauteriza le am cauteri migier am cauteri olivar.	When you treat it with what we have said in the division, and your treatment is not effective, then prepare and give the patient cockleshells to drink for three nights; and afterward, shave his head and cauterize it with a medium-sized cautery and an olive-oil cautery.
E aprop cauteriza aquel am cauteri clavelh am dos cauteris sobre les dos sobrecilhs dejos les cabels un petit.	And then cauterize it with a clove-shaped cautery, using two cauteries on the two eyebrows below the hair, a small one.
E guarda te de la arceria que no incindas aquela.	And be careful of the sparks so you do not ignite the area.
E del cauteri clavilh aquesta es la forma.	And this is the shape of the clove-shaped cautery.
Capitol .xv.	Chapter 15.
De cauteri de mollificacio de palpebras dels huels.	Of cauterization for softening the eyelids of ulcers.
Quan la palpebra del huel es mollificada per malautia o per humiditat, lahoras cauteriza aquela palpebre1 am un cauteri am aquest cauteri lunar; e aquesta es la forma de lu:	When the eyelid of an ulcer is softened by illness or moisture, then cauterize that eyelid with a cautery using this lunar cautery; and this is its shape:
E si vos, cauteriza aquel sobre les dos sobrecils un petit am dos cauteris en tota partida, e sian elonguatz de las timporas.	And if you cauterize it, do so above the two eyebrows a little bit with two cauteries on all sides, and they should be elongated away from the temples.
E sia la longitut de quascun cauteri segon la quantitat del sobrecil.	And the length of each cautery should be according to the amount of the eyebrow.
E no premas trop la tua ma am le cauteri, mays segon la quantitat que la tersa partida de la palpebre sia adhurida.	And do not press your hand with the cautery too much, but according to the amount that the third part of the eyelid is adhered.
Capitol .xvi.	Chapter 16.
De cauteri de la palpebre del huel quan les pels so convertitz a las partidas dedintz e punho le huel.	Of cauterizing the eyelid of the eye when the lashes are turned inwards and pierce the eye.
Quan les pels del huel son convertitz a las partidas dedintz ayssi que pungo le huel, cauteri en aquels es segon dos manieyras, quar cauteri o es am fer o es am medicina comburent.	When the lashes of the eye are turned inwards so that they pierce the eye, cauterization in those cases is in two ways: either with cauterization through burning or with a comburent medicine.
Si am cauteri de lu am foc, comanda al malaute denant aquo que leyse les sieus pels ayssi cum aquels les quals les mundan, entro que sian prolonguatz e engualhatz; e si punho aquel deves le lor naysement, lahoras tu strenh les huels de lu am una benda per so que no sia maugut entro que·ls pels sian nascutz.	If with a cautery of fire, first command the patient to cut their lashes like those who trim them, until they are extended and straightened; and if you pierce it near their origin, then you must bind the patient's eyes with a bandage so they are not aggravated until the lashes have grown back.
Donc cum siran nascutz e engualhatz, lahoras pausa le cap del malaute en le tieu se, e aprop senha sobre la palpebre dels huels de lu am tenta, am senhal le qual sia segon la figura de fulha de merta, e sia le comensament del senhal prop dels pels.	Then, once they have grown back and straightened, place the patient's head on your lap, and then carefully touch the eyelids of their eyes with a stylus, making a mark in the shape of a myrtle leaf, starting the mark near the eyelashes.
E aprop pausa coto enbegut en album de huou o en mucillatge de ptilli sobre le huel.	And then place cotton soaked in egg white or plantain poultice on the eye.
E aprop igneys le cauteri del qual aquesta es la forma de lu.	And then apply the cautery, which has this shape.
E aprop cauteriza sobre la figura la qual as senhada, petit a petit, em motas veguadas, entro que sia comburida la superficia de la codena la qual es ayssi cum fuelha de mirta, tota aparent propriament.	And then cauterize the area you marked, little by little, several times, until the surface of the affected area, which is approximately like a myrtle leaf, is completely burned away.
E senhal de sanetat de la tieua obra es que tu vegus la palpebre de l’huel ja esser contrayta e·ls pels de lu esser elevatz deves la punctura del huel.	A sign of the success of your work is that you see the eyelid of the eye now contracted and the hairs of the eye raised towards the puncture of the eye.
E donc eleva la tua ma e laysa aquel per tres jorns, e aprop pausa sobre lu coto am boder entro que sia eredicada la scara.	And then raise your hand and leave it for three days, and then place cotton with a bandage on it until the scab is removed.
E aprop cura aquela am enguent entro que sia sanat.	And then treat it with ointment until it is healed.
Mays si retorna per les pels alcuna causa aprop lor naysement e la palpebra es mollificada, lahoras fay autra vetz le cauteri sobre aquel tot ayssi cum avias fayt primieyrament.	But if any cause returns to the root of the hair and the eyelid becomes softened, then again perform cautery on that area, just as you did at first.
Mays si les pels so en la palpebra dejos, lahoras cauterisa aquela entro que sia elevada al sieu loc natural e sia engualhat e que les pels no punhan le huelh.	But if the hairs are under the eyelid, then cauterize them until they are raised to their natural place, are embedded, and the hairs no longer scratch the eye.
Mays le cauteri am medicina comburent aquest es que comandes al malaute que leyse les pels entro que sian prolonguatz e engualhatz, e aprop sia fayta de carta de drap la forma de fuelha de mirtra.	But the cautery with burning medicine is that you command the patient to pull out the hairs until they are elongated and embedded, and then a leaf-shaped bandage of cloth should be fashioned.
E aprop pren de sabo conogut e de caus viva ana unc. i, o quays aquo, e aprop mescle3 aquelas causas be, e fay aquo am festinacio per so que no sia enfregidat; e aprop expandeys de aquo sobre la carta la qual es fayta ayssi cum forma de fulha de mirtra, e pausa aquel sobre la un huel od amdos; e pausa dejos le huel coto enbegut en album de huou, e el cap del malaute sia en le tieu se.	And then take known herbs and living things, or whatever that is, and mix these things well, and do this quickly so that it does not get cold; and then spread some of this mixture onto the cloth bandage shaped like a myrtle leaf, and place it over one or both eyes; and put a cloth soaked in egg white under the eye, and the patient's head should be on your lap.
E pausa le dit sobre le medicina e prem aquela un petit e no la mauguas entro que lo malaute senta la mordicacio de la medicina, quar mordicacio es en lu ayssi cum de foc.	And place the finger on the medicine and press it a little, and do not remove it until the patient feels the medicine's burning sensation, for the burning sensation is there just like a fire.
E donc cum percevera aquo que el atrobo mordicacio, lahoras leyssa la medicina e mau aquela am le tieu dit; donc cum cessa la mordicacio, lahoras remau la medicina he lava le huel am aygua; e lahoras considera si vezes la palpebra ja es levada ayssi cum es lavada deves la costriccio am foc o am incisio, quar lahoras esta be; e si no torna sobre aquela de la medicina sobre le loc en le qual no ha empremut la medicina e no se denigra entro que sia engualhada la tua operacio e sia contrayt le huel.	And so, when he perceives the burning sensation, then remove the medicine and move it with your finger; then when the burning stops, then remove the medicine and wash the eye with water; and then consider if the eyelid has already been lifted, as if it were loosened from constriction by fire or incision, for then it is good; and if not, return to applying the medicine to the area where the medicine did not take effect, and do not give up until your procedure is successful and the eye is healed.
E aprop pausa sobre lu coto am boder entro que sia eradicada la codena de la adhustio, e aprop cura aquel am enguent deafinicon o am autre entro que sia sanat.	And then apply a bandage to it until the burning is completely gone, and then treat it with a definitive ointment or something else until it is healed.
E es necessari a tu, deves la tua operacio que guardes am pervigil diligencia que en le huel no caia re de la medicina, e si la palpebre aprop alscus dias es mollificada e alcuna causa dels pels punh en le huel, lahoras itera la tua medicina sobre aquel loc le qual de la palpebre es mollificat, e propriamen ayssi quo as fayt al comensament, e aprop enaviro lu entro que sia sanat.	And it is necessary for you, after your procedure, to watch with careful diligence that nothing of the medicine gets into the eye, and if after a few days the eyelid is softened and some cause of the hairs gets into the eye, then reapply your medicine to the softened area of the eyelid, and precisely as you did at the beginning, and then continue until it is healed.
E aquesta es la forma de fuelha de mirtra.	And this is the method for treating eye injuries.
E sapias que les huels dels homes son diversificatz segon la magnitut e la parvitat, e donc segon aquo es fayta la tua contraccio.	And know that human eyes vary in size and shape, and therefore your treatment is tailored accordingly.
E no sira amaguada la via de rectetut ad aquel al qual es studi en aquesta art.	And the way to recovery will not be hidden from the one who studies this art.
Capitol .xvii.	Chapter 17.
De cauterizacio de fistula que es en le lacrimal de l’huel.	Of cauterization of fistulas in the tear duct of the eye.
Quan tu curas fistula am aquo que havem dit en las divisios de las malautias e no confereys la tua curacio, lahoras cove que tu cauterizas aquela segon aquesta manieyra: comanda al malaute que pause le cap sieu en le tieu se, e tengua le cap de lu alcun ministre entre las tieuas mas en tal manieyra que no sia maugut ni agitat am le sieu cap.	When you treat a fistula using the methods described in the divisions of illnesses, and your treatment doesn't work, then you must cauterize it in this manner: tell the patient to place their head on your lap, and have a servant hold their head between your hands in such a way that it is not moved or shaken by their head.
E aprop pausa coto enfus en album de huou o en mucellage de ptilli sobre le huel de lu.	And then place a piece of cotton soaked in egg white or marshmallow on their eye.
E aprop igneys le cauteri del qual aquesta es la forma:	And then apply the cautery, whose form is:
le qual sia conquau, ayssi cum es forma de cana o de pena de voltor, de la una extremitat am la qual es fayta lo cauteri.	which should be concave, like the shape of a reed or a bird's feather, on the end with which the cautery is made.
E si voys, sia penetrant entro a la autra extremitat.	And if desired, let it penetrate to the other end.
E si vols sia sort ayssi cum tenta.	And if you want, let it be shaped like a probe.
Mays empero aquel que es concau es milhor a la tieua obra.	But nonetheless, the concave one is better for your work.
E aprop prem la fistula si es uberta, e tra de lu sania et exsicca aquela.	And then press the fistula if it is open, and extract and dry that [matter].
E si no es uberta, lahoras obre aquela e extratz la poyredura de lu.	And if it is not open, then open it and extract the pus from it.
E aprop pausa sobre lu le cauteri le qual sia be ignit, e te am aquel la tieua ma un petit deves le cauteri del huel a la partida del nas, per so que no erre la tua ma o le malaute sia enquietat, e lahoras pausa le cauteri en le grays del huel e corrompas aquel.	And then place the cautery, which is well-heated, upon it.  Hold the cautery with your hand, a little away from the cautery's hot part, near the bridge of the nose, so that neither your hand nor the patient is disturbed. Then place the cautery on the inflamed area and cauterize it.
E donc si al comensament del tieu cauteri perve entro al os, bo es; e sino, lahoras itera le cauteri una veguada o dos, si mestiers era; e layssa aquel ayssi per tres jorns, e aprop pausa sobre aquel coto am boder e enviro lu am enguent exsiccatiu entro que sia sanat.	And so, if your cautery penetrates to the bone, it is good; and if not, then repeat the cautery once or twice, if necessary.  Leave it like that for three days, and then place cotton with a bandage on it and apply a drying ointment until it is healed.
Mays si eran passatz xi dias e no es sanat, lahoras pausa sobre lu medicina aguda corrosiva entro que l’os sia descubert e sia ras segon que conveneys en le sieu capitol.	But if more than ten days have passed and it is not healed, then apply a sharp, corrosive medicine until the bone is exposed and is clean as is appropriate in your chapter.
E es autra manieyra de cauteri de fistula la qual alscus primiers diysero: enten al loc de la fistula e fen aquela e aprop pausa en aquela fissura camaen subtil del qual es la forma de lu: E fon en aquela la quantitat de i unc de plom fundut; e te la tua ma am camaem am bona retencio, e no sia maugut le malaute per so que le plom fundut no pervengua al huel de aquel; e cove que pausas sobre le huel del malaute coto enfus en album de huou o en aygua, quar plom adhureys le loc de la fistula e sana aquela per sanacio meravilhora.	And there is another method of cauterizing a fistula, which some earlier practitioners described as follows:  Apply to the location of the fistula and create an opening there; then place within that fissure a fine, thin piece of lead (of which the form is: [description of form is missing from the text]).  Place this amount of molten lead (about 1 ounce); and hold it firmly with your hand, so that the patient is not moved, to prevent the molten lead from reaching the eye. You should place on the patient's eye a cotton swab dipped in egg white or water, because molten lead will adhere to the fistula opening and heal it with remarkable success.
E si la fistula es sanada am aquo que havem dit del cauteri e de la curacio, bo es; e sino, lahoras es necessari aministrar trauc del nas e reduzir la fistula al cors del nas segon que vindra en son loc propri.	And if the fistula is healed by what we have said about the cautery and its treatment, then it is good; but if not, then it is necessary to make a hole in the nose and to push the fistula back into the nasal passage, returning it to its proper place.
Capitol .xviii.	Chapter 18.

Motas veguadas accideysso fissuras en las labias, e majorment en las labias dels enfantz.	Many times fissures occur in the lips, especially in the lips of children.
Donc cum tu curas aquelas fissuras am aquo que nos havem dit en las divisios e no aprofieyta la tua cura, lahoras igneys le cauteri petit cutellar segon aquesta forma que s’ensiec:	Therefore, if you treat those fissures with what we have described in the sections and your treatment is ineffective, then heat the small, knife-like cautery according to this form that is described/shown:

Capitol .xix.	Chapter 19.
De cauterizacio de fistula en la boca.	Concerning the cauterization of fistulas in the mouth.
Quan en la razit de uvula o en le paladar o en las razitz de las dentz endeve apostema e aprop fa brac, e aprop es rompuda, e aprop es antiquada, e corr brac e es fayta fistula, e aprop tu curas aquela e no aprofieyta a curacio, lahoras cove que tu igniscas cauteri segon la quantitat que sia receubuda en la fistula, e aprop met aquel ignit en le trauc de la fistola, e te la tua ma entro que pervengua le ferr ignit al preon de lu, e al derier de lu fazen aysso una veguada o dos; e aprop cura aquel am aquo que nos havem dit de la curacio entro que sia sanat.	When in the root of the uvula, or on the palate, or in the roots of the teeth, an abscess develops, then bursts, and subsequently becomes chronic, and an ulcer forms, and a fistula develops, and you treat it, but the treatment is ineffective, then you should cauterize with fire according to the size of the opening of the fistula.  Then introduce that heated instrument into the fistula's opening, and hold it until the heated iron reaches the bottom of the ulcer.  This is done once or twice, and then treat it with the remedies previously described until it heals.
E donc si la sania es abscindita e es sanat, bo es; e sino, lahoras es necessari de descubrir le loc e hostar le os corrumput segon que vindra en son capitol.	And so, if the pus is expelled and the wound heals, it is good; and if not, then it is necessary to uncover the area and remove the decayed bone, as explained in its relevant chapter.
Capitol .xx.	Chapter 20.
De cauterisacio de las dentz e de mollificacio de las angivas.	Concerning the cauterization of teeth and the softening of the gums.
Quan las angivas son mollificadas per humiditat e las dentz son maugudas, e curas aquelas am medicinas e no confereys, lahoras pausa le cap del malaute en le tieu se, e aprop igneys le cauteri la forma del qual vindra aprop aysso, enayssi que tu pauses la quanula sobre la dent e entromet en aquela le cauteri ignit festinantment, e te la tieua ma un petit entro que·l malaute cente la calor del foc a la razit de la dent esser pervenguda.	When the gums are softened by moisture and the teeth are aching, and treatment with medications is ineffective, then place the patient's head on your lap.  Then heat the cautery, shaped as described below, so that you place the nozzle over the tooth and quickly introduce the heated cautery into it. Hold it for a short time so that the patient feels the heat of the fire reaching the root of the tooth.
E aprop leva la tua ma, e aprop itera le cauteri alcunas veguadas segon que vols.	And then remove your hand, and repeat the cauterization several times as desired.
E aprop le malaute huompla la sua boca de aygua de sal e tengua aquela per una hora, e pueys stupa aquela, quar la dent mauguda es fermada e la gengiva mollificada es strenguda e la humiditat corrompuda es exsiccada.	Then have the patient fill their mouth with salt water and hold it for an hour, and then spit it out. For the aching tooth is sealed, the softened gums are tightened, and the corrupt moisture is dried.
Capitol .xxi.	Chapter 21.
De cauterisacio de dolor de dent.	Concerning the cauterization of tooth pain.
Quan dolor de dent es per fregiditat, o en lu es freg o verm, o no comfereys la curacio am medicina, lahoras cauteri en aquela es segon dos manieyras: o cauteri am boder de vacas, o cauteri am foc.	When tooth pain is caused by cold, or there is a cold or worm in the area, and medicinal cures do not work, then cauterization of that area is done in two ways: either with cow dung cautery, or with fire cautery.
Cauteri am boder es que tu prenguas boder de vacas e bulhas aquel en culhe de ferr , e aprop pren coto e envolopa le sobre la extremitat de la tenta, e aprop enmergeys aquel am boder bulhit, e pausa aquel sobre la dent dolorosa festinantment entro que sia enfregidat.	Cauterization with cow dung is done by taking cow dung and boiling it in a metal dish, then taking a piece of cloth and wrapping it around the end of a probe, dipping that cloth in the boiled dung and promptly placing it on the aching tooth until it cools down.
E aprop itera aquela alcunas veguadas entro que la vertut del foc pervengua a la razit de la dentz.	And then repeat this a few times until the heat's effect reaches the root of the tooth.
E si voys, submergeys lana o coto en le boder desus dit, e pausa aquel sobre la dent dolent, e pausa sobre aquel ferr ignit entro que·l ferr pervengua al preon de la conquavitat de la dent.	And if desired, dip wool or cloth in the aforementioned cow dung and place it on the aching tooth, and place the heated iron onto that until the iron reaches the point of the tooth cavity.
Mays empero la cauterizacio am foc es que tu atendas a la quannula de eram o de ferr, e sia en le cor de lu alcuna grocesa e la acuitat del foc no pervengua a la boca del malaute.	However, cauterization with fire is done by holding a heated iron or bronze instrument, ensuring its thickness is such that the heat doesn't reach the patient's mouth.
E aprop igneys le cauteri la forma del qual vindra, e pausa aquel sobre la dent e te la tua ma entro que·l cauteri sia enfregidat; e fay aquo alcunas veguadas quar la dolor sira remauguda o en aquel dia o en l’autre dia.	Then heat the cautery, making sure of its shape, and place it on the tooth, and hold it there until the cautery cools; do this several times, for the pain may disappear either that day or the next day.
E cove que per empressio de aquel cauteri que·l malaute umpla la sieua boca de bon boder e tengua aquel per una hora e aprop scupa le; e aquesta es la forma del cauteri.	And it is necessary that, by pressing with the cautery, the patient fill their mouth with good cow dung and hold it for an hour, and then spit it out; and this is the method of cauterization.
E cauteriza am qual que tu voys extremittat segon que a tu es possible.	And cauterize any extremity, as is possible for you.
E aquesta es la forma de la cannula:	And this is the method of the cannula:

De cauterizacio de extrophulos.	Of cauterization of extrophy.
Quan extrophulos so de flecma e de humors fregas e no so hobedientz a digistio per medicinas e tu voys la digistio de aquelas leugerament, lahoras tu igneys le cauteri conquau la forma del qual es aquesta seguen, havent dos extremitatz hubertas per que yesca le fum deves le cauteri per l’autra extremitat, e pausa aquel ignit sobre aquel apostema una veguada, e autre si indigeyses de aquel, entro que pervengua al preon del apostema.	When extrophy is due to phlegm and cold humors, and is not amenable to digestion by medicines, and you desire to digest them easily, then you heat the cautery, the shape of which is this, having two open ends so that smoke escapes from the cautery through one end, and place that heated cautery upon the abscess once, and again if needed, until it reaches the base of the abscess.
E si l’apostema es pauca, lahoras pausa le cauteri segon la quantitat del apostema, e aprop leyssa le per tres jorns e pausa sobre lu coto enfus en boder entro que sia remaugut aquo que·l foc ha comburit. De cauterizacio de rauquiera de votz e de constriccio de ale.	Concerning the cauterization of a sore throat and the constriction of the ale (possibly meaning the windpipe/trachea).

Capitol .xxv.	Chapter 25.
De cauterizacio de titillic que es le cap del ajutori.	Of cauterization of the 'titillic,' which is the head of the aid.
Quan le cap del ajutori es dislocat per causa de humiditatz lubricas e no es fermat en la hora del sieu retornament deves la sua dislocacio entro que sia a lu aquo costuma de retornar, e aprop per un petit movement es deslocat ayssi que s’endeve, ayssi cum nos havem testificat, lahoras cove que primieyrament redusiscas la dislocacio, e aprop le malaute sia reversat sobre le sieu dos o sobre le latz sa; e aprop eleva la codena la qual es en la partida dedintz del citillic a las partidas desus am les ditz de la tua ma sinistra, si la junctura es dislocada a las partidas dedintz.	When the head of the 'ajutori' (a part of the body, possibly the clavicle) is dislocated due to lubricating humidity and is not secured at the time of its return to its original position, until it is correctly positioned there, and then, due to a small movement, it is easily displaced again, as we have witnessed,  then it is necessary to first reduce the dislocation, and afterwards turn the patient over on their back or side; then lift the bone (the clavicle) that is in the inner part of the 'titillic' to the upper parts, using the fingers of your left hand, if the joint is dislocated inwards.
